main event: Observers reported seeing a bright, round object in the sky over Houston, Texas, with varying colors and characteristics, observed multiple times between October 5 and October 14, 1954.
interesting points: Multiple sightings occurred over a span of 10 days,One observer described the object as having a white, reddish-orange glow and being stationary,Two different observers reported a similar bright blue and red pulsating light,Air Force pilots and a civilian observer noted the object's movement and its comparison to meteors,Radar observations indicated unidentified returns with some uncertainty regarding reflections from the ground or clouds.
sighted object: round, bright object with changing colors
witness description: Observers included civilians and military personnel, with varying reliability, ages, and job descriptions.
